info.name: Spinal cord, ventral lateral sulcus
info.description: The ventral lateral sulcus of the spinal cord is AKA the anterolateral sulcus. It is a poorly defined sulcus marked by the exit of the ventral roots of the spinal cord. This sulcus extends rostrally into the medulla where it separates the pyramid from the olive. The rootlets of the hypoglossal nerve emerge from this sulcus in the medulla.
